IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: to organize, advertise, and stage pro rodeo circuit finals rodeo events and award prize money and awards from sponsors and contributors to professional rodeo athletes.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE PRORODEO CIRCUITS ORGANIZE, ADVERTISE AND STAGE CIRCUITS FINALS RODEO EVENTS AND SERVE AS A CONDUIT FOR THE DISTRIBUTING PRIZE MONEY AND AWARDS FROM SPONSORS AND CONTRIBUTORS TO PROFESSIONAL RODEO ATHLETES.
IRS990.Desc: Organizing, Advertising, and Staging circuit finals rodeos in 11 of the 12 professional rodeo association (PRCA) circuits . The PRCA Circuits reported within this group return are the following: Badlands, Columbia River, First Frontier, Great Lakes, Montana, Mountain States, Prairie, Southeastern, Texas, Turquoise, and Wilderness. The twelfth circuit, California, completes its own return.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the related organization, the Professional Rodeo Cowboy Association (PRCA), has a BOARD APPOINTED COMPENSATION COMMITTEE who REVIEW COMPARABLE COMPENSATION PACKAGES AND CONSULT WITH an INDEPENDENT PERSON for the compensation package of the CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER. BOARD APPOINTED COMPENSATION COMMITTEE also REVIEWS the SALARY AND WAGE PROPOSALS FOR THE ENTIRE ORGANIZATION AS PART OF THE ORGANIZATION'S ANNUAL BUDGETING PROCESS. THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING AN EMPLOYEES SALARY OR WAGE PER THE ORGANIZATION BYLAWS. DETERMINING AN EMPLOYEES SALARY OR WAGE PER THE ORGANIZATION BYLAWS.

Mr. Tom Glause is an employee of PRCA Properties, Inc, and receives all his compensation from PRCA Properties, Inc. Mrs. Pamela McManus is an employee of Professional Rodeo Cowboy Association (PRCA), and receives all her compensation from PRCA.

Each Circuit has five (5) voting board members; the voting board members within each circuit hold the following positions: Committee director, Stock Coordinator director, Contract Personnel director, Riding Event director, and Timed Event Director. Each Circuit has also up to four (4) Officer positions that do not vote on the Board. Non-voting Officer positions within each Circuit are the following: President, Vice President, Secretary , and Treasurer.
THE OFFICERS OF THE PRORODEO CIRCUITS MAY BE RELATED TO OTHER MEMBERS SERVING IN JOINT CAPACITIES AS OFFICERS, RODEO COMMITTEE MEMBERS AND RODEO EVENT REPRESENTATIVES.

The board of directors for each u.s. circuit is appointed by the related organization, Professional Rodeo Cowboy Association EIN 84-0414922, at the regularly scheduled meeting in the first quarter of each calendar year.

The related organization, Professional Rodeo Cowboy Association EIN 84-0414922, governs most aspects of the Circuits' rodeo activities, and may designate a Circuit coordinator to oversee matters pertaining to the Circuits.
FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY an outside, independent cpa firm AND REVIEWED WITH THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD PRIOR TO BEING FILED BY THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER.
OFFICERS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ON INTEREST PRIOR TO ACCEPTING THEIR RESPECTIVE POSITIONS AND AT ANY TIME IN THE FUTURE A CONFLICT MAY ARISE.
PRORODEO CIRCUIT OFFICERS ARE PAID A MINOR STIPEND FOR THEIR CONTRIBUTION TO THE ORGANIZATION AND PRODUCTION OF THE PRORODEO CIRCUIT FINALS RODEOS.

IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE RESPECTIVE PRORODEO CIRCUITS TO MAKE AVAILABLE THEIR GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO THE PUBLIC. FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUEST TO THE PROFESSIONAL RODEO COWBOYS ASSOCIATION.
Prior period adjustment: Subsequent the filing of the 2021 tax return, a cash reconciliation discrepancy was found and addressed.
